message_1: If we use a Caesar cipher with a shift of 5, what is the encrypted message of the plaintext "MATH"?
message_2:
To encrypt the message "MATH" using a Caesar cipher with a shift of 5, we shift each letter 5 positions forward in the alphabet. If a letter goes past 'Z', it wraps around to the beginning of the alphabet.

M -> R (M + 5)
A -> F (A + 5)
T -> Y (T + 5)
H -> M (H + 5)

So, the encrypted message is "RFYM".
